org.sfm.jdbc

Interface JdbcMapper<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type that the mapper is mapping to
    All Superinterfaces:
    FieldMapper<ResultSet,T>, Mapper<ResultSet,T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDynamicJdbcMapper, AbstractForEachDynamicJdbcMapper, AbstractJdbcMapper, DiscriminatorJdbcMapper, DynamicJdbcMapper, JdbcMapperImpl, JoinJdbcMapper

    public interface JdbcMapper<T>
extends Mapper<ResultSet,T>
    JdbcMapper will map from a ResultSet to an object of the specified type T

    JdbcMapper are instantiable via JdbcMapperFactory.

    JdbcMapper<MyClass> mapper = JdbcMapperFactory.newInstance().newMapper(MyClass.class);

    ...

    try (ResultSet rs : ps.executeQuery()){
        mapper.stream(rs).forEach(System.out::println);
    }

    See Also:
    JdbcMapperFactory

    • Method Detail

      • forEach

        <H extends RowHandler<? super T>> H forEach(ResultSet rs,
                                            H handle)
                                     throws SQLException,
                                            MappingException
        Loop over the resultSet, map each row to a new instance of T and call back the handler

        The method will return the handler passed as an argument so you can easily chain the calls like
        List<T> list = mapper.forEach(rs, new ListHandler<T>()).getList();

        Type Parameters:
        H - the row handler type
        Parameters:
        rs - the resultSet
        handle - the handler that will get the callback
        Returns:
        the handler passed in
        Throws:
        SQLException - if sql error occurs
        MappingException - if an error occurs during the mapping

      • iterator

        Iterator<T> iterator(ResultSet rs)
              throws SQLException,
                     MappingException
        Parameters:
        rs - the result set
        Returns:
        an iterator that will return a map object for each row of the result set.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if sql error occurs
        MappingException - if an error occurs during the mapping

      • iterate

Iterator<T> iterate(ResultSet rs)
                         throws SQLException,

        Throws:

        MappingException

      • stream

        Stream<T> stream(ResultSet rs)
          throws SQLException,
                 MappingException
        Parameters:
        rs - the result set
        Returns:
        a stream that will contain a map object for each row of the result set.
        Throws:
        SQLException - if sql error occurs
        MappingException - if an error occurs during the mapping
